title: Wand of opening
data:
- *[Opening](/wiki/Opening "Opening") redirects here. For the invocation artifact, see [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"). For the opening to [the game](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack"), see [Introduction](/wiki/Introduction "Introduction").*

| /               |                                                               |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name            | opening                                                       |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Abundance       | [2.5%](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand")                          |
| Base price      | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight          | 7                                                             |
| Type            | beam                                                          |
| Maximum charges | 8                                                             |
| Spell           | [knock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_knock "Spellbook of knock")        |
| Monster use     | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **wand of opening** can be used to unlock [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") and [containers](/wiki/Container "Container"), escape [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") monsters, and remove [punishment](/wiki/Punishment "Punishment"). The effect is identical to that of the spell [knock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_knock "Spellbook of knock").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effect (wand of opening and knock)](#Effect_.28wand_of_opening_and_knock.29)

  - [1.1 On monsters](#On_monsters)
  - [1.2 On movable objects](#On_movable_objects)
  - [1.3 On you](#On_you)
  - [1.4 On immovable objects](#On_immovable_objects)

- [2 See also](#See_also)

- [3 References](#References)

## Effect (wand of opening and knock)

Except where noted, a wand of opening will be identified if it had any effect and you can observe the effect (e.g., you can see the affected object).

### On monsters

- Monster regurgitates the player if [engulfed](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- Removes monster's saddle, if worn, dropping it on the monster's square[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) (including your steed's saddle if you zap downward while riding[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)).

Regardless, if the zap strikes any monster, the monster does not necessarily get an immediate chance to attack the player, as it would with most spell strikes.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) This will *not* identify a wand of opening.

### On movable objects

- Striking a [punished](/wiki/Punishment "Punishment") player's chain (but not the ball) will unpunish you.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- Unlocks [large boxes](/wiki/Large_box "Large box") and [chests](/wiki/Chest "Chest") ("Klick!") and fixes the lock if broken.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

Either of these effects will identify a wand of opening, even if the affected object cannot be seen.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

### On you

If you are [punished](/wiki/Punishment "Punishment"), you will receive the message "Your chain quivers for a moment.", and the wand will be identified.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

### On immovable objects

- Reveals and unlocks hidden doors ("A door appears in the wall!"), and unlocks non-hidden doors ("The door unlocks!"). The door remains closed.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
- Interrupts attempts to break down a door with a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"), and repairs the door.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)
- If you zap up or down while on a closed [portcullis](/index.php?title=Portcullis\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Portcullis (page does not exist)") (possible with [phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing")), it will open.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)
- If you zap down while on the [quest level](/wiki/Quest_level "Quest level")'s down stairs before your leader permits you to go on the quest, you will receive the message "The stairs seem to ripple momentarily."[\[12\]](#cite_note-12) and the wand will be identified.
- Opens [drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge").[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)
- Triggers [trapdoors](/wiki/Trapdoor "Trapdoor") and [falling rock traps](/wiki/Falling_rock_trap "Falling rock trap")[\[14\]](#cite_note-14) (only if someone stands on the trap).
- Releases you or a monster from a [bear trap](/wiki/Bear_trap "Bear trap") or a [web](/wiki/Web "Web").[\[15\]](#cite_note-15) The monster may be pacified if adjacent.

## See also

- [Wan1-343.txt](/wiki/Wan1-343.txt "Wan1-343.txt")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 239](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line239 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 246](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line246 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [zap\_steed](/wiki/Source:Zap.c#zap_steed "Source:Zap.c") in [zap.c](/wiki/Source:Zap.c "Source:Zap.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 238](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line238 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1491](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line1491 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [Zap.c#line1589](/wiki/Zap.c#line1589 "Zap.c"), [Lock.c#boxlock](/wiki/Lock.c#boxlock "Lock.c")
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1593](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line1593 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2100](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line2100 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [doorlock](/wiki/Source:Lock.c#doorlock "Source:Lock.c") in [Lock.c](/wiki/Source:Lock.c "Source:Lock.c")
10. [↑](#cite_ref-10) [doorlock](/wiki/Source:Lock.c#doorlock "Source:Lock.c") in [Lock.c](/wiki/Source:Lock.c "Source:Lock.c")
11. [↑](#cite_ref-11) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2316](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line2316 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
12. [↑](#cite_ref-12) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2320](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line2320 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
13. [↑](#cite_ref-13) [zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2678](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/zap.c#line2678 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/zap.c")
14. [↑](#cite_ref-14) [openfallingtrap](/wiki/Source:Trap.c#openfallingtrap "Source:Trap.c") in [trap.c](/wiki/Source:Trap.c "Source:Trap.c")
15. [↑](#cite_ref-15) [openholdingtrap](/wiki/Source:Trap.c#openholdingtrap "Source:Trap.c") in [trap.c](/wiki/Source:Trap.c "Source:Trap.c")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Wand of opening

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Opening redirects here. For the invocation artifact, see Bell of Opening. For the opening to the game, see Introduction.
/
Name opening
Appearance random
Abundance 2.5%
Base price 150 zm
Weight 7
Type beam
Maximum charges 8
Spell knock
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

A wand of opening can be used to unlock doors and containers, escape engulfing monsters, and remove punishment. The effect is identical to that of the spell knock.

Contents

  • 1 Effect (wand of opening and knock)
    • 1.1 On monsters
    • 1.2 On movable objects
    • 1.3 On you
    • 1.4 On immovable objects
  • 2 See also
  • 3 References

Effect (wand of opening and knock)

Except where noted, a wand of opening will be identified if it had any effect and you can observe the effect (e.g., you can see the affected object).

On monsters

  • Monster regurgitates the player if engulfed.[1]
  • Removes monster's saddle, if worn, dropping it on the monster's square[2] (including your steed's saddle if you zap downward while riding[3]).

Regardless, if the zap strikes any monster, the monster does not necessarily get an immediate chance to attack the player, as it would with most spell strikes.[4] This will not identify a wand of opening.

On movable objects

  • Striking a punished player's chain (but not the ball) will unpunish you.[5]
  • Unlocks large boxes and chests ("Klick!") and fixes the lock if broken.[6]

Either of these effects will identify a wand of opening, even if the affected object cannot be seen.[7]

On you

If you are punished, you will receive the message "Your chain quivers for a moment.", and the wand will be identified.[8]

On immovable objects

  • Reveals and unlocks hidden doors ("A door appears in the wall!"), and unlocks non-hidden doors ("The door unlocks!"). The door remains closed.[9]
  • Interrupts attempts to break down a door with a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock, and repairs the door.[10]
  • If you zap up or down while on a closed portcullis (possible with phasing), it will open.[11]
  • If you zap down while on the quest level's down stairs before your leader permits you to go on the quest, you will receive the message "The stairs seem to ripple momentarily."[12] and the wand will be identified.
  • Opens drawbridges.[13]
  • Triggers trapdoors and falling rock traps[14] (only if someone stands on the trap).
  • Releases you or a monster from a bear trap or a web.[15] The monster may be pacified if adjacent.

See also

  • Wan1-343.txt

References

  1. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 239
  2. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 246
  3. ↑ zap_steed in zap.c
  4. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 238
  5. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1491
  6. ↑ Zap.c#line1589, Lock.c#boxlock
  7. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1593
  8. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2100
  9. ↑ doorlock in Lock.c
  10. ↑ doorlock in Lock.c
  11. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2316
  12. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2320
  13. ↑ zap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2678
  14. ↑ openfallingtrap in trap.c
  15. ↑ openholdingtrap in trap.c

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

:''[[Opening]] redirects here.  For the invocation artifact, see [[Bell of Opening]]. For the opening to [[NetHack|the game]], see [[Introduction]].''

{{wand
  |name=opening
  |type=beam
  |cost=150
  |maxcharges=8
  |abundance=2.5%
  |spell=knock
}}

A '''wand of opening''' can be used to unlock [[door]]s and [[container]]s, escape [[engulfing]] monsters, and remove [[punishment]].  The effect is identical to that of the spell {{spell of|knock}}.

==Effect (wand of opening and knock)==
Except where noted, a wand of opening will be identified if it had any effect and you can observe the effect (e.g., you can see the affected object).

===On monsters===
* Monster regurgitates the player if [[engulf|engulfed]].{{refsrc|zap.c|239}}
* Removes monster's saddle, if worn, dropping it on the monster's square{{refsrc|zap.c|246}} (including your steed's saddle if you zap downward while riding<ref>{{function|zap.c|zap_steed}}</ref>).

Regardless, if the zap strikes any monster, the monster does not necessarily get an immediate chance to attack the player, as it would with most spell strikes.{{refsrc|zap.c|238}}  This will ''not'' identify a wand of opening.

===On movable objects===
* Striking a [[punishment|punished]] player's chain (but not the ball) will unpunish you.{{refsrc|zap.c|1491}}
* Unlocks [[large box]]es and [[chest]]s ("Klick!") and fixes the lock if broken.<ref>[[Zap.c#line1589]], [[Lock.c#boxlock]]</ref>

Either of these effects will identify a wand of opening, even if the affected object cannot be seen.{{refsrc|zap.c|1593}}

===On you===
If you are [[punishment|punished]], you will receive the message "Your chain quivers for a moment.", and the wand will be identified.{{refsrc|zap.c|2100}}

===On immovable objects===
* Reveals and unlocks hidden doors ("A door appears in the wall!"), and unlocks non-hidden doors ("The door unlocks!").  The door remains closed.<ref>{{function|Lock.c|doorlock}}</ref>
* Interrupts attempts to break down a door with a [[pick-axe]] or [[dwarvish mattock]], and repairs the door.<ref>{{function|Lock.c|doorlock}}</ref>
* If you zap up or down while on a closed [[portcullis]] (possible with [[phasing]]), it will open.{{refsrc|zap.c|2316}}
* If you zap down while on the [[quest level]]'s down stairs before your leader permits you to go on the quest, you will receive the message "The stairs seem to ripple momentarily."{{refsrc|zap.c|2320}} and the wand will be identified.
* Opens [[drawbridge]]s.{{refsrc|zap.c|2678}}
* Triggers [[trapdoor]]s and [[falling rock trap]]s{{reffunc|trap.c|openfallingtrap}} (only if someone stands on the trap).
* Releases you or a monster from a [[bear trap]] or a [[web]].{{reffunc|trap.c|openholdingtrap}}  The monster may be pacified if adjacent.

==See also==
* [[Wan1-343.txt]]
